Sentencas: Sm and Ti co-doped ceria-based mixed ion-electronic conductor with the compositions of Sm0.2Ce0.8-xTixO2-delta(x = 0-0.15) are prepared by a gel-casting process.
Titulo: The Effect of TiO2Addition on the Electrical Properties of Ce0.8Sm0.2O2-δElectrolyte Material for SOFCs

Sentencas: The effects of addition of Ti on the phase compositions, the sintering behavior, and the electrochemical properties of sample are investigated.
Titulo: The Effect of TiO2Addition on the Electrical Properties of Ce0.8Sm0.2O2-δElectrolyte Material for SOFCs

Sentencas: The article tentatively discusses the relation of conductivity with Po(2)by defect principles.
Titulo: The Effect of TiO2Addition on the Electrical Properties of Ce0.8Sm0.2O2-δElectrolyte Material for SOFCs

Sentencas: Results show that the single-phase fluorite structure can be formed only at 500 degrees C, the addition of certain quantity TiO(2)can promote the sintering densification with a uniform grain growth.
Titulo: The Effect of TiO2Addition on the Electrical Properties of Ce0.8Sm0.2O2-δElectrolyte Material for SOFCs

Sentencas: When the sintering temperature is 1350 degrees C, the sample with 10% addition of Ti has the highest relative density, it reaches 98.94% of the theoretical density, which is much higher than the one prepared by the solid state method.
Titulo: The Effect of TiO2Addition on the Electrical Properties of Ce0.8Sm0.2O2-δElectrolyte Material for SOFCs

Sentencas: The conductivity of samples decreases while the conductive activation energy increases by adding TiO2.
Titulo: The Effect of TiO2Addition on the Electrical Properties of Ce0.8Sm0.2O2-δElectrolyte Material for SOFCs

Sentencas: Besides, it should not be neglected that the conductivity of samples in H(2)is much higher than in air, which attributes to the reduction of Ti and Ce ions in reducing atmosphere.
Titulo: The Effect of TiO2Addition on the Electrical Properties of Ce0.8Sm0.2O2-δElectrolyte Material for SOFCs

Sentencas: Overall, above test and analysis results suggest that TiO(2)could be used only as an effective sintering aid but cannot as co-dopant on the optimization of electrical properties for ceria-based electrolytes.
Titulo: The Effect of TiO2Addition on the Electrical Properties of Ce0.8Sm0.2O2-δElectrolyte Material for SOFCs
